program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 bringing home the dead großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : embalmers pick up the bodies from makeshift morgues in thailand , a voluntary team of embalmers is making sure germans who died in the floods can be flown home as soon as possible . while foreign minister joschka fischer arrives in bangkok friday , begining a tour of the worst-affected areas to take a look at where and how berlin 's aid is being spent , some 7000 german survivors have already flown back home . the foreign ministry might have confirmed that the number of dead is lower than previously feared , but the official toll of german lives lost in late december has already reached 60 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a woman looks at photographs of the deceased at an emergency relief center in phuket , thailand .
almost two weeks after the devastating tsunami disaster in southeast asia , some 751 germans are registered missing with the police , while up to 300 more are believed lost .
many families are realizing they may never know what happened to their loves ones . as time goes by , tropical temperatures take their toll on the many corpses , making identification even harder .
and until they 've been identified by the federal criminal police office -lrb- bka -rrb- , they ca n't be flown home . embalming in disaster zones international embalming experts are now arriving in the region , tasked with preserving the bodies and thereby facilitating the identification process . sven tittelbach-helmrich from thüringen is one of them . a qualified thanatologist , he and some forty colleagues set up a german-wide organization five and a half years ago called " death care embalming , " which works in disaster-hit regions . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : two women weep as they sit amongst the rubble of their earthquake destroyed house in the city of bingol , southeastern turkey on may 2 , 2003 .
previous missions include the earthquake turkey in 2003 -lrb- photo -rrb- and in taiwan in 1999 . scenes of devastation several days after the floods , tittelbach-helmrich and an embalming team were sent by the government to thailand with officers from the bka . scenes of devastation awaited them in phuket .
wearing protective suits and gas masks , their job was to prepare the bodies of german tourists for transportation back to europe . " in most cases it was n't possible to embalm them properly , because that happens via the vascular system , " he told german public broadcaster mdr .
" the condition of many of the corpses simply did n't allow it .
all we could do was disinfect the organs to slow down the process of decay . " grief mingled with relief bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a buddhist monk looks at bodies of victims tittelbach-helmrich and his nine colleagues spent a week collecting bodies that had been identified from makeshift morgues in temples .
most of them were german , but others were dutch , swedish and belgian .
it was a week the thanatologist said he 'll never forget . " when i looked at the walls of posters of young women , men , small children , babies i could n't help thinking about the bodies lying in the temples , " he told mdr . what kept him going was the families ' gratitude their dead had been spared a mass grave in thailand and could be buried back home . " when you see their relief you feel you 've done something useful , " he said . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a gruesome task for criminologists in the wake of last week ’ s tsunamis , some 300 experts are working around the clock to identify victims .
with more than 30 years experience , germany has sent its team of forensic scientists to the region . -lrb- jan .
3 , 2005 -rrb- tourism after the flood thailand , sri lanka and the maldives are among the most popular holiday destinations for germans .
but after the devastation wrought on these and other asian resorts by the tsunamis , will germans still go there in droves ?
-lrb- jan .
5 , 2005 -rrb- training to bury the dead starting this year , germans who want to become undertakers can receive a formal education for the job .
while thousands of young people are still looking for apprenticeships , 75 have already signed up for the program .

almost two weeks after the devastating tsunami disaster in southeast asia , some 751 germans are registered missing with the police , while up to 300 more are believed lost .
many families are realizing they may never know what happened to their loves ones . as time goes by , tropical temperatures take their toll on the many corpses , making identification even harder .
and until they 've been identified by the federal criminal police office -lrb- bka -rrb- , they ca n't be flown home . embalming in disaster zones international embalming experts are now arriving in the region , tasked with preserving the bodies and thereby facilitating the identification process . sven tittelbach-helmrich from thüringen is one of them . a qualified thanatologist , he and some forty colleagues set up a german-wide organization five and a half years ago called " death care embalming , " which works in disaster-hit regions . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : two women weep as they sit amongst the rubble of their earthquake destroyed house in the city of bingol , southeastern turkey on may 2 , 2003 .
previous missions include the earthquake turkey in 2003 -lrb- photo -rrb- and in taiwan in 1999 . scenes of devastation several days after the floods , tittelbach-helmrich and an embalming team were sent by the government to thailand with officers from the bka . scenes of devastation awaited them in phuket .
wearing protective suits and gas masks , their job was to prepare the bodies of german tourists for transportation back to europe . " in most cases it was n't possible to embalm them properly , because that happens via the vascular system , " he told german public broadcaster mdr .
" the condition of many of the corpses simply did n't allow it .
all we could do was disinfect the organs to slow down the process of decay . " grief mingled with relief bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a buddhist monk looks at bodies of victims tittelbach-helmrich and his nine colleagues spent a week collecting bodies that had been identified from makeshift morgues in temples .
most of them were german , but others were dutch , swedish and belgian .
it was a week the thanatologist said he 'll never forget . " when i looked at the walls of posters of young women , men , small children , babies i could n't help thinking about the bodies lying in the temples , " he told mdr . what kept him going was the families ' gratitude their dead had been spared a mass grave in thailand and could be buried back home . " when you see their relief you feel you 've done something useful , " he said . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a gruesome task for criminologists in the wake of last week ’ s tsunamis , some 300 experts are working around the clock to identify victims .

3 , 2005 -rrb- tourism after the flood thailand , sri lanka and the maldives are among the most popular holiday destinations for germans .

while thousands of young people are still looking for apprenticeships , 75 have already signed up for the program .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 13:00 utc german airline taps bulgaria again german low-cost airline bexx air , whose offices in sofia were closed down in september for operating without a licence , is trying to go into business under a new name of " imagine air " , the bulgarian press reported friday .
imagine air will offer low-cost flights on the internet to and from germany , britain and the netherlands , much like bexx air did for eight months before bulgarian authorities shut its offices for operating without a proper licence .
bexx air then cancelled its flights and over 100 passengers are still waiting to get money back for their unused tickets .
dirk wiesemann , bexx air 's chief executive has promised the new company will reimburse all bexx air 's clients .
according to media reports , the bulgarian transport ministry has refused to liberalize the aviation market and let in major low cost airlines such as irish budget airline ryanair . dw-world.de lufthansa forges ahead with cost-cutting lufthansa airlines has reached an agreement with pilots to freeze pay and make hours more flexible .
it 's part of the company 's strategy to get out of the economic blues largely brought on by low-cost carriers . -lrb- dec.12,2004 -rrb- more briefs 07.01.2005 -pipe- bundesbank profits hit by strong euro 06.01.2005 -pipe- tax amnesty raises money for germany 06.01.2005 -pipe- trucks avoid german highways 06.01.2005 -pipe- deutsche börse offers eurex to london 05.01.2005 -pipe- eu approves deficit breach for tsunami aid 05.01.2005 -pipe- anti-cancer drug to come out soon 05.01.2005 -pipe- nordlb seeks € 800 million injection 05.01.2005 -pipe- audi employees to work longer radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .
european business week listen to the latest edition of european business week media center watch and listen explore new content daily in dw 's multimedia archive .
dw-tv europe live journal we 're sorry , due to legal issues this content can not be transmitted as live stream .
if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .
dw-radio live spectrum listen live banking get an inside look at some of germany 's more unusual companies .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 13:00 utc german airline taps bulgaria again german low-cost airline bexx air , whose offices in sofia were closed down in september for operating without a licence , is trying to go into business under a new name of " imagine air " , the bulgarian press reported friday .
imagine air will offer low-cost flights on the internet to and from germany , britain and the netherlands , much like bexx air did for eight months before bulgarian authorities shut its offices for operating without a proper licence .
bexx air then cancelled its flights and over 100 passengers are still waiting to get money back for their unused tickets .
dirk wiesemann , bexx air 's chief executive has promised the new company will reimburse all bexx air 's clients .
according to media reports , the bulgarian transport ministry has refused to liberalize the aviation market and let in major low cost airlines such as irish budget airline ryanair . dw-world.de lufthansa forges ahead with cost-cutting lufthansa airlines has reached an agreement with pilots to freeze pay and make hours more flexible .
it 's part of the company 's strategy to get out of the economic blues largely brought on by low-cost carriers . -lrb- dec.12,2004 -rrb- more briefs 07.01.2005 -pipe- bundesbank profits hit by strong euro 06.01.2005 -pipe- tax amnesty raises money for germany 06.01.2005 -pipe- trucks avoid german highways 06.01.2005 -pipe- deutsche börse offers eurex to london 05.01.2005 -pipe- eu approves deficit breach for tsunami aid 05.01.2005 -pipe- anti-cancer drug to come out soon 05.01.2005 -pipe- nordlb seeks € 800 million injection 05.01.2005 -pipe- audi employees to work longer radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

car market on road to recovery -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 22.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business 125 years automobile science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 14:00 utc car market on road to recovery after four years of falling sales , the german car market appears to have turned the corner with new car registrations rising by one percent to 3.267 million vehicles in 2004 , data published by the auto industry federation vda showed on friday .
it was the first time since 1999 that the number of new registrations - a measure of domestic demand in the sector - had risen on an annual basis , vda said in a statement . a surge in demand towards the end of the year helped buoy full-year figures , the association found . in december alone , new car registrations were up 22 percent at 282,000 vehicles .
" that is pleasing , particularly as german brands appear to have moved into the fast lane , " said vda president bernd gottschalk .
" the successful model offensive met with a pick-up in consumption at the end of the year .
but it does n't alter the fact that the car industry did meet fulfill all of its hopes in 2004 , " gottschalk said . dw-world.de german cars motor ahead in us german carmakers bmw and daimlerchrysler closed the year with better than expected us sales .
compared to the previous year , the two car companies have edged closer to their us and japanese competition . -lrb- jan .
5 , 2005 -rrb- more briefs 07.01.2005 -pipe- german airline taps bulgaria again 07.01.2005 -pipe- bundesbank profits hit by strong euro 06.01.2005 -pipe- tax amnesty raises money for germany 06.01.2005 -pipe- trucks avoid german highways 06.01.2005 -pipe- deutsche börse offers eurex to london 05.01.2005 -pipe- eu approves deficit breach for tsunami aid 05.01.2005 -pipe- anti-cancer drug to come out soon 05.01.2005 -pipe- nordlb seeks € 800 million injection radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .
european business week listen to the latest edition of european business week media center watch and listen explore new content daily in dw 's multimedia archive .

catastrophe in japan - how the japanese expatriate community in düsseldorf is reacting extracting gas in germany - searching for shale our studio guest : felix matthes from the institute for applied ecology stock exchange today in history 1312 : dissolution of the order of the knights templar © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

it was the first time since 1999 that the number of new registrations - a measure of domestic demand in the sector - had risen on an annual basis , vda said in a statement . a surge in demand towards the end of the year helped buoy full-year figures , the association found . in december alone , new car registrations were up 22 percent at 282,000 vehicles .
" that is pleasing , particularly as german brands appear to have moved into the fast lane , " said vda president bernd gottschalk .
" the successful model offensive met with a pick-up in consumption at the end of the year .
but it does n't alter the fact that the car industry did meet fulfill all of its hopes in 2004 , " gottschalk said . dw-world.de german cars motor ahead in us german carmakers bmw and daimlerchrysler closed the year with better than expected us sales .
compared to the previous year , the two car companies have edged closer to their us and japanese competition . -lrb- jan .

car market on road to recovery -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.08.2011 home news germany europe world asia business 125 years automobile science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 14:00 utc car market on road to recovery after four years of falling sales , the german car market appears to have turned the corner with new car registrations rising by one percent to 3.267 million vehicles in 2004 , data published by the auto industry federation vda showed on friday .
it was the first time since 1999 that the number of new registrations - a measure of domestic demand in the sector - had risen on an annual basis , vda said in a statement . a surge in demand towards the end of the year helped buoy full-year figures , the association found . in december alone , new car registrations were up 22 percent at 282,000 vehicles .
" that is pleasing , particularly as german brands appear to have moved into the fast lane , " said vda president bernd gottschalk .
" the successful model offensive met with a pick-up in consumption at the end of the year .
but it does n't alter the fact that the car industry did meet fulfill all of its hopes in 2004 , " gottschalk said . dw-world.de german cars motor ahead in us german carmakers bmw and daimlerchrysler closed the year with better than expected us sales .
compared to the previous year , the two car companies have edged closer to their us and japanese competition . -lrb- jan .
5 , 2005 -rrb- more briefs 07.01.2005 -pipe- german airline taps bulgaria again 07.01.2005 -pipe- bundesbank profits hit by strong euro 06.01.2005 -pipe- tax amnesty raises money for germany 06.01.2005 -pipe- trucks avoid german highways 06.01.2005 -pipe- deutsche börse offers eurex to london 05.01.2005 -pipe- eu approves deficit breach for tsunami aid 05.01.2005 -pipe- anti-cancer drug to come out soon 05.01.2005 -pipe- nordlb seeks € 800 million injection radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

controversy over politicians ' corporate pay -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.08.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 13:00 utc controversy over politicians ' corporate pay debate is raging in germany over politicians who are on company payrolls after it emerged that a senior official of the opposition christian democratic union party -lrb- cdu -rrb- is allegedly receiving a substantial salary from dresdner bank .
in its friday edition , daily die welt published a list of parliamentarians receiving monthly allowances by major companies such as insurance giant allianz or the energy supplier vattenfall .
the german press focussed this week primarily on cdu politician hildegard müller , a close aide of opposition leader angela merkel , who newspapers say continues to receive a salary from dresdner bank .
german carmaker volkswagen plans to publish a list of employees on its payrolls who also hold a political office , including two social democrat politicians in the regional state parliament of lower saxony .
cdu secretary general laurenz meyer stepped down shortly before christmas after it emerged he had allegedly received substantial payouts from energy giant rwe , as well as discounts on his electricity bills and a low-interest loan . head of the bundestag or lower house of parliament , wolfgang thierse , has called for a debate about the rules regarding politicians ' corporate pay . dw-world.de german opposition deputy resigns german opposition leader angela merkel 's deputy , laurenz meyer , resigned on wednesday after being heavily criticized for failing to fully declare payments and electricity subsidies he received from his former employer .
-lrb- dec .
22 , 2004 -rrb- more briefs 06.01.2005 -pipe- german town helps tsunami-hit areas 06.01.2005 -pipe- states change jewish immigration rules 05.01.2005 -pipe- hezbollah official forced out of germany 05.01.2005 -pipe- thousands volunteer for world cup 05.01.2005 -pipe- france to extradite top german ex-official 04.01.2005 -pipe- german police : al qaeda trained 70,000 04.01.2005 -pipe- germany to raise aid to € 500 million 04.01.2005 -pipe- german shipyards to slash jobs radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

22 , 2004 -rrb- more briefs 06.01.2005 -pipe- german town helps tsunami-hit areas 06.01.2005 -pipe- states change jewish immigration rules 05.01.2005 -pipe- hezbollah official forced out of germany 05.01.2005 -pipe- thousands volunteer for world cup 05.01.2005 -pipe- france to extradite top german ex-official 04.01.2005 -pipe- german police : al qaeda trained 70,000 04.01.2005 -pipe- germany to raise aid to € 500 million 04.01.2005 -pipe- german shipyards to slash jobs radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 07.01.2005 -pipe- 13:00 utc controversy over politicians ' corporate pay debate is raging in germany over politicians who are on company payrolls after it emerged that a senior official of the opposition christian democratic union party -lrb- cdu -rrb- is allegedly receiving a substantial salary from dresdner bank .
in its friday edition , daily die welt published a list of parliamentarians receiving monthly allowances by major companies such as insurance giant allianz or the energy supplier vattenfall .
the german press focussed this week primarily on cdu politician hildegard müller , a close aide of opposition leader angela merkel , who newspapers say continues to receive a salary from dresdner bank .
german carmaker volkswagen plans to publish a list of employees on its payrolls who also hold a political office , including two social democrat politicians in the regional state parliament of lower saxony .
cdu secretary general laurenz meyer stepped down shortly before christmas after it emerged he had allegedly received substantial payouts from energy giant rwe , as well as discounts on his electricity bills and a low-interest loan . head of the bundestag or lower house of parliament , wolfgang thierse , has called for a debate about the rules regarding politicians ' corporate pay . dw-world.de german opposition deputy resigns german opposition leader angela merkel 's deputy , laurenz meyer , resigned on wednesday after being heavily criticized for failing to fully declare payments and electricity subsidies he received from his former employer .
-lrb- dec .
22 , 2004 -rrb- more briefs 06.01.2005 -pipe- german town helps tsunami-hit areas 06.01.2005 -pipe- states change jewish immigration rules 05.01.2005 -pipe- hezbollah official forced out of germany 05.01.2005 -pipe- thousands volunteer for world cup 05.01.2005 -pipe- france to extradite top german ex-official 04.01.2005 -pipe- german police : al qaeda trained 70,000 04.01.2005 -pipe- germany to raise aid to € 500 million 04.01.2005 -pipe- german shipyards to slash jobs radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

in its friday edition , daily die welt published a list of parliamentarians receiving monthly allowances by major companies such as insurance giant allianz or the energy supplier vattenfall .
the german press focussed this week primarily on cdu politician hildegard müller , a close aide of opposition leader angela merkel , who newspapers say continues to receive a salary from dresdner bank .

eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid -pipe- current affairs -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 15.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .
-lrb- jan 6 , 2004 -rrb- feedback if you would like to comment on this or any other dw-world story , write to us .
please include your name and country in your response . radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour dw-world.de check out our latest interactive web features dw screensaver social bookmarking our rss feeds dw widgets integrated search dw on facebook newsletters netvibes.com the way you want it mobile optimized for pdas newsletters news in your inbox audio / video podcasts © dw 2010 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .

7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .

eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid -pipe- current affairs -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 22.04.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .
-lrb- jan 6 , 2004 -rrb- feedback if you would like to comment on this or any other dw-world story , write to us .
please include your name and country in your response . radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour dw-world.de check out our latest interactive web features dw screensaver social bookmarking our rss feeds dw widgets integrated search dw on facebook newsletters netvibes.com the way you want it mobile optimized for pdas newsletters news in your inbox audio / video podcasts © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .

but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .

7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .
-lrb- jan 6 , 2004 -rrb- feedback if you would like to comment on this or any other dw-world story , write to us .
please include your name and country in your response . radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour dw-world.de check out our latest interactive web features dw screensaver social bookmarking our rss feeds dw widgets integrated search dw on facebook newsletters netvibes.com the way you want it mobile optimized for pdas newsletters news in your inbox audio / video podcasts © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid -pipe- current affairs -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 07.01.2005 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.08.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de current affairs -pipe- 07.01.2005 eu ministers coordinate tsunami aid großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german development minister heidemarie wieczorek-zeul friday foreign , health and development ministers from the european union came together on friday for quickly arranged talks to coordinate further plans to help those countries affected by the asian tsunamis . at the emergency meeting in brussels , ministers considered proposals for possible debt relief for countries in the region as well as creating a rapid reponse team to deal with future humanitarian catastrophes .
the main aim of the meeting , according to the eu presidency , was to coordinate ideas ahead of a un-hosted donors ' conference in geneva next week . " there are a number of ideas which have been floated , " francoise le bail , a spokeswoman for the european commission , told reporters .
" it is important to make sure that the response we make , the proposals we put forward , are the right ones . " besides ministers from the 25-member bloc , participants included david nabarro , the top official at the world health organization -lrb- who -rrb- dealing with humanitarian crises , as well as carol bellamy , the head of unicef . rapid response and long-term aid besides debt relief , ministers threw their support behind a tsunami warning system for the indian ocean region .
they also looked at how it might respond to large-scale disasters in the future . earlier in the week , the eu 's external affairs commissioner , benita ferrero-waldner , had proposed creating a 5000-strong " crisis management corps . "
but at the meeting on friday , eu governments said they preferred putting the focus on a " rapid response " aid force that would be made up of coordinated national forces . germany 's foreign minister , joschka fischer , called on the eu to improve coordination in response to crises , warning that for a response force to be effective , it would have to first be efficient . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors in sri lanka discussions in brussels also included a german initiative to partner countries , municipalities and even schools in europe with the region to help with long-term reconstruction . the eu and its member states have pledged aid to the region worth nearly € 1.5 billion -lrb- $ 2 billion -rrb- in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami disaster which has left more than 146,000 dead , including hundreds , possibly thousands of european tourists . eu governments so far have pledged over € 1 billion in aid while the eu commission has earmarked € 450 million . helping themselves , too eu ministers also stressed the need for governments of countries in the region to continue to play their part in helping their own citizens and warned that the long-running internal conflicts in sri lanka and the aceh province of indonesia should not interfere with relief efforts . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german soldiers perpare emergency hospital containers for shipment to indonesia " the council launched an appeal so that aid can be delivered rapidly to all populations concerned , independent of the internal conflicts in some of the countries affected , " said the ministers in a draft conclusion document . several ministers at the meeting were returning from or heading to the disaster region .
germany 's fischer is scheduled to fly to thailand directly after the talks .
his british counterpart , jack straw , was absent from the meeting since he is currently in the region . temporary refuge on friday , the eu 's commissioner for justice , freedom and security , franco frattini , told the italian newspaper la repubblica that europe might offer temporary refuge to hundreds of thousands of children affected by the disaster . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : survivors are threatened by epidemics he said he had proposed offering to bring the children to the eu for several months , which would hopefully allow them to recover from their trauma and put them beyond the reach of criminal gangs which have been reported targeting lone children . the united nations children 's fund confirmed a case in indonesia of trafficking in children orphaned or separated from parents .
countries were warned to be on high alert for kidnappers . bringing children to the eu would require an extension of the bloc 's temporary asylum rules . the united nations estimates that 1.5 million children have been affected and are likely to suffer more than adults . " there are thousands of european families ready to take them in , " frattini told the paper . dw staff -lrb- jam -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans offer early warning help there 's long been talk of creating a tsunami warning system , but now it 's time for action .
dw-world spoke to birger-gottfried lühr of the geo research center in potsdam , which wants to help .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- tsunami aid to have little economic impact several nations have pledged unprecedented amounts of aid to countries struck by the asian tsunami .
but the record sums wo n't create massive budgetary problems around the world , according to experts .
-lrb- jan .
7 , 2004 -rrb- germany promises € 500 million in aid german chancellor schröder pledged € 500 million -lrb- $ 661 million -rrb- towards reconstruction efforts in the tsunami-affected regions of south asia on wednesday , making germany one of the single largest donors so far .
-lrb- jan 6 , 2004 -rrb- radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour dw-world.de check out our latest interactive web features dw screensaver social bookmarking our rss feeds dw widgets integrated search dw on facebook newsletters netvibes.com the way you want it mobile optimized for pdas newsletters news in your inbox audio / video podcasts © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .
